MemoryIndex

class babydragon.memory.indexes.memory_index.MemoryIndex[source]

this class is a wrapper for a faiss index, it contains information about the format of the index the faiss index itself

init_index(index: Index | None = None, values: List[str] | None = None, embeddings: List[List[float] | ndarray] | None = None, is_embed_batched: bool = False) → None[source]

initializes the index, there are 4 cases: 1. we create a new index from scratch 2. we create a new index from a list of embeddings and values 3. we create a new index from a faiss index and values list 4. we load an index from a file

classmethod from_pandas(data_frame: DataFrame | str, columns: str | List[str] | None = None, name: str = 'memory_index', save_path: str | None = None, in_place: bool = True, embeddings_col: str | None = None, markdown: str = 'text/markdown') → MemoryIndex[source]

Initialize a MemoryIndex object from a pandas DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • data_frame – The DataFrame or path to a CSV file.

  • columns – The columns of the DataFrame to use as values.

  • name – The name of the index.

  • save_path – The path to save the index.

  • in_place – Whether to work on the DataFrame in place or create a copy.

  • embeddings_col – The column name containing the embeddings.

Returns:

A MemoryIndex object initialized with values and embeddings from the DataFrame.

classmethod from_hf_dataset(dataset_url: str, value_column: str, embeddings_column: str | None = None, name: str = 'memory_index', save_path: str | None = None, embedder: ~babydragon.models.embedders.ada2.OpenAiEmbedder | ~babydragon.models.embedders.cohere.CohereEmbedder | None = <class 'babydragon.models.embedders.cohere.CohereEmbedder'>, is_batched: bool = False, markdown: str = 'text/markdown') → MemoryIndex[source]

Initialize a MemoryIndex object from a Hugging Face dataset.

Parameters:

  • dataset_url – The URL of the Hugging Face dataset.

  • value_column – The column of the dataset to use as values.

  • embeddings_column – The column of the dataset containing the embeddings.

  • name – The name of the index.

  • save_path – The path to save the index.

Returns:

A MemoryIndex object initialized with values and embeddings from the Hugging Face dataset.

add_to_index(value: str, embedding: List[float] | ndarray | str | None = None, verbose: bool = False, default_save: bool = False) → None[source]

index a message in the faiss index, the message is embedded (if embedding is not provided) and the id is saved in the values list

add_batch_to_index(values: List[str], embeddings: List[float] | ndarray | str | None = None, verbose: bool = False, default_save: bool = False) → None[source]

index a message in the faiss index, the message is embedded (if embedding is not provided) and the id is saved in the values list

remove_from_index(value: str) → None[source]

Remove a value from the index and the values list. :param value: The value to remove from the index.

get_embedding_by_index(index: int) → ndarray[source]

Get the embedding corresponding to a certain index value.

get_index_by_value(value: str) → int | None[source]

Get the index corresponding to a value in self.values.

get_embedding_by_value(value: str) → ndarray | None[source]

Get the embedding corresponding to a certain value in self.values.

get_all_embeddings() → ndarray[source]

Get all the embeddings in the index.

faiss_query(query: str, k: int = 10) → Tuple[List[str], List[float]][source]

Query the faiss index for the top-k most similar values to the query

token_bound_query(query, k=10, max_tokens=4000)[source]

Query the faiss index for the top-k most similar values to the query, but bound the number of tokens retrieved by the max_tokens parameter
